snippet: Monster Beverage said no blood test had been performed to confirm a medical examiner’s determination that a 14-year-old girl died of caffeine toxicity.
abstract: Monster Beverage defends its energy drinks against lawsuit accusing them of being responsible for death of 14-year-old Maryland girl Anais Fournier, saying no blood test had been performed to confirm autopsy report's statement that she died of caffeine toxicity.
lead_paragraph: Monster Beverage said no blood test had been performed to confirm a medical examiner’s determination that a 14-year-old girl died of caffeine toxicity.

headline.main: Energy Drink Is Defended in Death Suit
headline.print_headline: Energy Drink Is Defended In Death Suit
